pr_title: [GEOT-6588] : SortBy element not encoded with FESConfiguration

timeline.message: [GEOT-6588] : SortBy element not encoded with FESConfiguration

timeline.bodyText: Should this not extend a V2_0 class?
timeline.author: ianturton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@ +/* + * GeoTools - The Open Source Java GIS Toolkit + * http://geotools.org + * + * (C) 2002-2008, Open Source Geospatial Foundation (OSGeo) + * + * This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or + * modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public + * License as published by the Free Software Foundation; + * version 2.1 of the License. + * + * This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, + * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of + * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU + * Lesser General Public License for more details. + */ +package org.geotools.filter.v2_0.bindings; + +import javax.xml.namespace.QName; +import org.eclipse.emf.common.util.UniqueEList; +import org.geotools.filter.v2_0.FES; +import org.opengis.filter.FilterFactory; + +/** + * Binding object for the type http://www.opengis.net/ogc:SortByType. + * + *

+ * + * 

+ *         
+ *  <xsd:complexType name="SortByType">
+ *      <xsd:sequence>
+ *          <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="SortProperty" type="ogc:SortPropertyType"/>
+ *      </xsd:sequence>
+ *  </xsd:complexType>
+ *
+ *          
+ *
+ * + * @generated + */ +public class SortByTypeBinding extends org.geotools.filter.v1_1.SortByTypeBinding {

replies.bodyText: There is some code shared beetwen v1 and v2 ( parsing method). This inheritance is used to override the target, the type and the getProperty
replies.author: eropartz

timeline.bodyText: Is this still needed? and if it is should it be?
timeline.author: ianturton

replies.bodyText: The code is identical between V1 and V2, so I used the class v1_1.SortOrderTypeBinding. If you prefer, I can create an empty class  v2.SortOrderTypeBinding which extends v1_1.SortOrderTypeBinding
replies.author: eropartz

replies.bodyText: No if they are identical then no problem, just caught my eye and have seen similar issues with this sort of mixing.
replies.author: ianturton

timeline.bodyText: Again this should probably extend a V2_0 class
timeline.author: ianturton
